Description: Wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; interior: streaky brown glaze; two friezes of alternating tongues and lotus flowers painted in red and white, separated by red band lined in white, details incised. Exterior, cream slip: two friezes separated by band with superimposed red bands lined in white; upper frieze has part of a goat to right, head no doubt turned; below, lotus flower and bud chain with red additions.
Curator's comments: Joins 1888,0601.a and c-d; from same bowl as e-g.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.228)
